item.title: Kohlrabi and apple slaw - a study in comparative literature
item.description:
This recipe is assembled from a variety of sources; I'll update when I've actually made it myself to report back.

The basic idea is that you make a dressing of mayo thinned with a little vinegar, and you use equal part shredded kohlrabi and shredded apple in the salad. Mustard is a common seasoning.

Some variations on the theme, with links to recipes:

  • AllRecipes adds prepared mustard, lemon juice, and sugar to the dressing
  • Epicurious replaces the mayo with heavy cream and adds some chopped parsley and mustard
  • Boston Organics follows Epicurious but replaces parsley with mint
  • The Floating Kitchen adds carrots, and replaces the mayo with Greek yogurt
  • Martha Stewart dresses the slaw with olive oil and lemon juice and skips the mayo
  • Edible Twin Cities adds some fennel to the salad

I could continue but this is enough meta-information to head to the kitchen.

item.title: Prime Red apples are in at Farmers Market (August 24, 2013)
item.description:
We got some Prime Red apples at Farmer's Market from Wasem's Fruit Farm.

Prime Red is also known as Akane or Tokyo Rose. From Orange Pippin, an encyclopedia of apples:

Akane was developed in Japan in the 1930s, and represents an unusual marriage of the classic English early variety, Worcester Pearmain, and the high quality American heritage apple variety, Jonathan - and it is a marriage that works very successfully.
